channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rick Stein's Food Stories
channel.desc: Rick rediscovers his love for the foodie heaven of Argyll, where land and loch yield exquisite produce. He meets chef Pamela Brunton, a Michelin Green Star winner, whose menu showcases local and foraged ingredients.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Hairy Bikers Go West
channel.desc: The Hairy Bikers explore Lancashire. For Dave, the trip is an emotional homecoming, as he was born in the county. They start their trip in the glorious beauty of Morecambe Bay and head to the kitchen to make a dish dedicated to Lancashire.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Digging for Britain
channel.desc: Digs in the West of Britain reveal a forgotten fortress teetering on the edge of a cliff, evidence of the oldest house in Cardiff and a discovery at a Roman mosaic that shocks the experts.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: QI XL
channel.desc: Sandi Toksvig indulges in a bit of well-earned R&R.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live at the Apollo
channel.desc: Ria Lina introduces stand-up comedians Lucy Beaumont and Josh Pugh to the stage.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Inside the Cult of the Jesus Army
channel.desc: A look at the origins of the Jesus Fellowship. Founded in the 1970s, its early vision of communal living, shared finances and spiritual commitment changes over time, becoming more structured and controlling. Unexplained deaths occur, and more.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: All the President's Men
channel.desc: Based on the Washington Post's investigation of the Watergate break-in which led to the most significant political scandal of the 1970s. With its painstaking reconstruction of the decade's political scene and tightly scripted view of the world of the newsroom, this film excitingly combines all the elements of investigative journalism with those of a tense thriller.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's railway journey through Cumbria and Dumfriesshire heads to the hills as he follows in the footsteps of the Lakeland poets. In Keswick, he retraces the adventurous walks of Samuel Taylor Coleridge.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
channel.desc: It is Week 2, and Judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young put the 11 remaining sewers through three challenges themed around active-wear. A seven-panel cap, a cycling kit transformation and stylish athleisure to take you from gym to coffee shop.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Animal Park
channel.desc: A dramatic new chapter begins at Longleat. After more than 50 years, hippos are returning to the park, but with hopes of creating a world-class breeding programme, the pressure is on. The team must race to finish a state-of-the-art hippo house.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Bidding Room
channel.desc: Nigel Havers and Simon Bower welcome John, with his vibrant trio of Sinclair C5s. However, his canine companion Ken isn't so keen on them, so he's looking to sell them for something a little more dog-friendly.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Former home secretary and Labour peer Lord David Blunkett is joined by soprano superstar Lesley Garrett for an antiques hunt across the county they love the most - Yorkshire.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Impossible
channel.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Boss
channel.desc: Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where being in control is everything. Who will emerge as the Boss and walk away with the cash? Only the strongest players will survive the game.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Tournament
channel.desc: Eight contestants compete in a series of fast-paced quiz battles in an attempt to eliminate their opponents from the day's game and walk away with a cash prize.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin presents a collection of the best finds from the show's travels around the country, visiting Edinburgh, Birmingham and Dunster Castle. Paul also visits the birthplace of DH Lawrence to discover more about the man behind the literature.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Rob Deering, Katya Jones, Jayne Middlemiss and Phil Tufnell take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rick Stein's Food Stories
channel.desc: Lincolnshire is a county of farming innovation, where Rick meets inventor James Dyson, who allows him special access to his farm of the future. Here, strawberries, tended by robots, are grown all year round.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: SOS: Extreme Rescues
channel.desc: An injured climber is stuck on a narrow ledge after falling 30 ft. Spaniel Buzz runs off a coastal cliff, and a couple's search for a social media hotspot lands them in danger.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Villages by the Sea
channel.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson is in North Yorkshire exploring how idyllic Runswick Bay was once a place of great danger, despite attracting tourists and inspiring artists.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
channel.desc: In the Tyrol region of Northern Italy lies Hotel Hubertus, a family-run resort which offers spectacular views of the surrounding mountains thanks to its panoramic aspect. Monica and Rob discover what it takes to run it as they go behind the scenes.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moors Murders: A Search for Justice
channel.desc: Six decades of suffering for the victims' families and a case that shook the nation. Revelations and newly uncovered evidence as experts pursue answers and, ultimately, justice.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
channel.desc: Paul and Bob travel to Dorset to fish the River Frome in search of grayling. As the pair fish along this unspoilt stretch of river, they realise grayling are not the only species roaming these waters. They attempt mackerel fishing on Chesil Beach.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Human
channel.desc: Shocking new insights into the demise of modern humans' sister species, the Neanderthals, Homo sapiens's possible role in their downfall and how it become the last human species on Earth.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Uncanny
channel.desc: Danny is joined by Liam, who grew up on a remote farm near Bury. His childhood was marred by ghostly sightings of a little boy and an oppressive presence, making him so terrified that, even as an adult, he refused to go upstairs in his house alone.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Lifeline
channel.desc: Leah Charles-King presents an appeal on behalf of Bipolar UK, a charity that provides support services to improve diagnosis, advance treatments and give critical help to anyone affected by bipolar and their families.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Chess Masters: The Endgame
channel.desc: Sue Perkins hosts this high-stakes chess contest, following 12 rising stars of the UK's booming chess community as they battle it out via a gauntlet of brain-bending puzzles and nail-biting eliminators to be crowned champion. In the first of two heats, six talented players from across the UK arrive at Cardiff's former coal exchange. They face a brain-boggling puzzle and a high-stakes speed chess battle.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Our Lives
channel.desc: At 300 years old, Tanfield in Gateshead is the world's oldest railway. To celebrate, volunteers are working against the clock to restore engines and create their biggest event yet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unforgivable
channel.desc: The Mitchell family deal with the devastating aftermath of an act of sexual abuse committed by a member of their own family who, after two years, is about to leave prison.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Animal Park
channel.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble celebrate one of Longleat's most remarkable residents, Anne the Asian elephant. Now in her 70s, Anne's story continues as her devoted keepers battle to give this elderly matriarch the comfortable retirement she so deserves.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: Sarah Moore tries to smash it with a fish tank transformation, and sign-writer Joel puts a new spin on two old record cabinets.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Monty examines how the garden is coping with the dry summer, and in the veg garden. Arit meets a gardener in Kent who has a deep connection with nature. Jamie Butterworth is at Battersea Dogs and Cats Home.

channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin presents a collection of the best finds from the show's travels around the country, visiting Edinburgh, Wallasey, Southwell, Birmingham and Dunster Castle. The antiques experts include Thomas Plant, Adam Partridge and James Lewis, with items ranging from a fantastic collection of war medals to a unique funeral invitation which Paul spots. Paul also goes on a tour of the Library of Birmingham, discovering what it's brought to the city.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Rob Deering, Katya Jones, Jayne Middlemiss and Phil Tufnell take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rick Stein's Food Stories
channel.desc: Amid Belfast's thriving food scene, Rick tucks into Filipino-style Sunday lunch. On Northern Ireland's Atlantic coast, he meets an award-winning chef who turns fish offal and underused species such as dog fish into stunning dishes.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day one highlights from the fifth Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: Following the men and women of the Royal National Lifeboat Institution (RNLI).

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Gone
channel.desc: When Irish journalist Aileen Ryan goes missing, Irish Detective Theo Richter and Kiwi Detective Diana Huia are compelled to remain in the small town of Mt Affinity to lead the search.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Inside No. 9
channel.desc: An Edwardian chiller, where a talented piano-tuner is forced to confront the power of a centuries-old curse by the owners and servants of a large country house.

channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Women's Open, LPGA Golf
channel.desc: Highlights from day 1 of the 2025 Women's Open.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: Antique furniture has restorer Peter attempting the impossible. Discover if all three pieces are too past it to pull in the cash.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: When a missing woman is found buried in her own back garden, family and friends raise suspicions about her long - term boyfriend. But police don't have much to go on - until he flees to Estonia.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weather: Beyond the Forecast
channel.desc: How hot is too hot? From heat labs to firefighting helicopter pilots and wineries, we look at how extreme heat impacts people and environments in the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Fake or Fortune?
channel.desc: A mysterious inscription, a famous name and a colossal price tag. Fiona Bruce and Philip Mould embark on a high-stakes quest to authenticate a `lost' Churchill. Is it genuine or a clever fake?

channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Animal Park
channel.desc: The team are pinning their hopes on a precious white-backed vulture chick, a species facing extinction in the wild. The park's pack of rare African painted dogs are put to the ultimate test. Hamza helps carry out a health check on a capybara.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Bidding Room
channel.desc: First up in Leith Theatre - is it an alligator? Is it a crocodile? The only thing Craig knows is that it is a massive six-and-a-half-foot-long, and his wife wants it gone. Second through the doors is young entrepreneur Numan.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Anna Haugh's Big Irish Food Tour
channel.desc: Sligo, often called Ireland's hidden gem, is full of culinary delights. Actor Pauline McLynn shows Anna around as they are put to work on an oyster farm during the busy season.

channel.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo concludes his epic rail journey across Norway and Denmark, crossing an 18-kilometre box girder bridge between the islands of Funen and Zealand, known as the Great Belt Bridge.

channel.desc: Paul Martin presents a collection of interesting and previously unseen finds from the show's travels round the country, visiting Muncaster Castle in Cumbria, The Bowes Museum in County Durham, The Grand Pier in Weston-super-Mare in Somerset and Norwich Cathedral in Norfolk.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rev.
channel.desc: Tired of feeling excluded and derided by the rest of society, Adam is thrilled to meet Leon who is keen to get married at St Saviour's. Leon sees past the dog collar and a friendship develops, with the pair sharing pints in the local pub and even jogging together. However, the bromance comes to a crashing halt at an embarrassing vicarage dinner party.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Panorama

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Human
channel.desc: The extraordinary story of how the human species, Homo sapiens, first emerged, where the discoveries of recent years are revolutionising the understanding of humanity's origin story.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Now, Voyager
channel.desc: A repressed spinster's struggles to break free from her overbearing mother and assert her independence. On the advice of a skilled psychiatrist, she embarks on a cruise, during which she finds love and self-esteem for the first time in her life. However, her new-found confidence is shaken when it is revealed her beau is a married man.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: An Ideal Husband
channel.desc: Adaptation of Oscar Wilde's comedy of manners about English society in the late 19th century. An MP's idyllic marriage is threatened by a blackmail plot, while his best friend, an extremely eligible bachelor, finds his independence threatened by the charms of the MP's sister.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Fake or Fortune?
channel.desc: Typical Renoir: you wait ages for an undiscovered masterpiece, and then two come along at once. The question is, are they genuine? In this double investigation, the team look into an early portrait and a charming little landscape.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Members of the public try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Actors Julie Graham and Tamzin Outhwaite are touring Sussex in a 1980s Citroen Dyane. Tamzin is best known for her roles in `EastEnders' and `Red Cap', while Julie is a well-known face from `Benidorm', `Doctor Who', and `Shetland'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Proms
channel.desc: The most iconic four notes in music history open Beethoven's famous symphony, performed by the Scottish Chamber Orchestra alongside Saint-Sa?ns's popular Fifth Piano Concerto.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day 3 highlights from the fifth Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Dexys at the BBC
channel.desc: Kevin Rowland looks back on his unique career, sets the record straight on a few pop myths, and shares stories behind many of those classic songs as he introduces the best of the band's BBC performances from over the decades.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top of the Pops
channel.desc: The Top of the Pops vaults are opened once more, this time to celebrate the mega-hits of 1982. A new pop sound had arrived, shattering the chart domination of mainstream pop-rock, which in turn coincides with a second British invasion of the US charts. Step forward Adam Ant, Yazoo, Wham, ABC and the Associates, all breakthrough acts in a golden year for British pop. Madness provide a little two-step with their ska revival, and Junior and Patrice Rushen's R&B tracks pack a punch.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top of the Pops
channel.desc: 1982 marks the peak of British `new pop' as Wham, ABC and Culture Club make sensational appearances, and Shalamar's Jeffrey Daniel premieres the moonwalk on British TV. Dexy's new Irish sound tops the summer charts for four weeks with `Come on Eileen', while their follow-up single Jackie Wilson Says leads to a notorious moment in TOTP history. Featuring ABC, Culture Club, Wham, Dexy's Midnight Runners, Shalamar, Pigbag, Foster and Allen, Shakatak and Bucks Fizz.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Women's Open, LPGA Golf
channel.desc: Highlights from day 3 of the 2025 Women's Open.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Here We Are
channel.desc: Aharon has devoted his life to raising his son Uri. They live together in a gentle routine, away from the real world. But Uri is autistic, and now as a young adult it might be time for him to live in a specialized home. While on their way to the institution, Aharon decides to run away with his son and hits the road, knowing that Uri is not ready for this separation. Or is it, in fact, his father who is not ready?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
channel.desc: Carol Kirkwood explores a host of gardening subjects that all begin with the letter U, getting advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters and programmes.

channel.title: The Shop Around the Corner
channel.desc: Two bickering clerks wage a running battle of words, unaware that they have become romantic pen pals.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Talking Pictures
channel.desc: A retrospective look at television appearances made over the years by Hollywood legend Bette Davis, capturing the milestones and highlights of her life and career.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: All About Eve
channel.desc: Classic multi-Oscar-winning comic drama. Keen fan Eve ingratiates herself into the life of sharp-tongued Broadway star Margo Channing, whose friends come to suspect the younger woman's intentions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
channel.desc: It's week 3, and we're celebrating design icons: Diane von Furstenberg, Vivienne Westwood and Versace.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin is in the Suffolk countryside at Glemham Hall, which dates back to the Tudor era. Antiques expert David Fletcher discovers some scripts from the television series `Lovejoy', and Jonathan Pratt spots some Beatles bobbing head dolls.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day 3 highlights from the fifth Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top Gear
channel.desc: Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the return of the hand-crafted, coach-built car with a trip to Italy to drive the achingly beautiful and incredibly rare Alfa Romeo-based Touring Disco Volante. Jack Whitehall is the `Star in the Reasonably Priced Car'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Inside the Cult of the Jesus Army
channel.desc: As more and more people are drawn into the Jesus Army through its outreach schemes, the 'modesty culture' within the organisation takes a dark turn.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Children of Men
channel.desc: When infertility threatens mankind with extinction and the last child born has perished, a disillusioned bureaucrat becomes the unlikely champion in the fight for the survival of Earth's population. He must face down his own demons and protect the planet's last remaining hope from danger.
